addGovernor(address).details: This function propagates the new governor role across most contracts of the protocolGovernor is also guardian everywhere in all contracts

deployStableMaster(address).details: To maintain consistency, the address of the `StableMaster` contract corresponding to the `AgToken` is automatically retrievedThe `StableMaster` receives the reference to the governor and guardian addresses of the protocolThe `AgToken` and `StableMaster` contracts should have previously been initialized with correct references in it, with for the `StableMaster` a reference to the `Core` contract and for the `AgToken` a reference to the `StableMaster`

governorList().details: This getter is used by `StableMaster` contracts deploying new collateral types and initializing them with correct references

removeGovernor(address).details: There must always be one governor in the protocol

revokeGuardian().details: Guardian is able to auto-revoke itselfThere can only be one `guardian` address in the protocol

revokeStableMaster(address).details: This function just removes a `StableMaster` contract from the `_stablecoinList`The consequence is that the `StableMaster` contract will no longer be affected by changes in governor or guardian occuring from the protocolThis function is mostly here to clean the mappings and save some storage space

setCore(address).details: To maintain consistency, checks are performed. The governance of the new `Core` contract should be exactly the same as this one, and the `_stablecoinList` should be identical

setGuardian(address).details: Guardian is able to change by itself the address corresponding to its roleThere can only be one guardian address in the protocolThe guardian address cannot be a governor address

stablecoinList().details: This getter is used by the `Core` contract when setting a new `Core`

deployStableMaster(address).notice: Adds a new stablecoin to the system

deployedStableMasterMap(address).notice: Map to track the addresses of the `stableMaster` contracts that have already been deployed This is used to avoid deploying a revoked `stableMaster` contract again and hence potentially creating inconsistencies in the `GOVERNOR_ROLE` and `GUARDIAN_ROLE` of this `stableMaster`

governorList().notice: Returns the list of all the governor addresses of the protocol

governorMap(address).notice: Map to track the addresses with a `GOVERNOR_ROLE` within Angle protocol

guardian().notice: Address of the guardian, it can be revoked by Angle's governance The protocol has only one guardian address

setCore(address).notice: Changes the `Core` contract of the protocol

stablecoinList().notice: Returns the list of all the `StableMaster` addresses of the protocol

userdoc.notice: Keeps track of all the `StableMaster` contracts and facilitates governance by allowing the propagation of changes across most contracts of the protocol (does not include oracle contract, `RewardsDistributor`, and some other side contracts like `BondingCurve` or `CollateralSettler`)
